questions.question_text:
Given the code fragment:

//IMG//


You want to validate a path name before the read file. Before validation, all path names should be canonicalized.

Which code inserted on line n1 will accomplish this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
answer : D
A canonical pathname is both absolute and unique. That means it includes getting absolute path and no removing redundant names (normalization).
ABC doesn't include both those operations. D includes it with file.getCanonicalPath();

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, only has a bad sintax canonicalPath pass to new Fileins(canonicalPah) no other opcion convert filename to canonical name only this

Selected Answer: B
B is best answer

C and D do not compile when tested

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
The file object is created using the filename variable.The getCanonicalPath() method is called on the file object to get the canonical path of the file.The canonicalPath variable is then used to create a new FileInputStream object.
This code will ensure that the path name is validated and canonicalized before the file is read.
D we use file.getCanonicalPath()

choices.C: Error reading files is printed on the console.
choices.B: An unchecked exception is thrown at run time.
choices.D: The content from filel.txt and file2.txt is printed on the console.
